page.title: 15A COTTAGE IN SHEFFIELD
page.content:
I live in a cottage in Crookes, {Sheffield.}It used to be two cottages but they were knocked together to make one. It was built in the{1850's,}and is a nice house to live in.
One of the rooms in my house is built over the garage and when it is windy the floorboards rattle, if you are in that room then, it feels as if the room is swaying. My parents' room used to be a stable and so did the garage, there is still an old horse shoe hanging on the wall outside the garage.
My house is called{Cocked Hat {Cottage.}This is because it is built on a piece of land which is triangular like a cocked hat, the kind that pirates used to wear.
